Georgia Crowther

Hi! I am a hardware-focused robotics engineer passionate about sustainability, equity, and the potential of new technologies on and off planet Earth.

I have a Masters in Robotic Systems Development from Carnegie Mellon University a Bachelor’s in Science from Cornell University in mechanical engineering. I’ve worked testing and designing unique wheels for NASA moon rovers (like VIPER!) and programming a robot arm to 3D printing large structures from bioplastics at Denizen. I also designed bikes and street infrastrucutre for Social Bicycles (later JUMP) and lead Cornell’s Mars Rover Project Team in the international University Rover Challenge.

Designed and programmed by: Me!
